intro: Adenophora thunbergiana var. hakusanensis, commonly known as the Hakusan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other bellflower species.
